body.p: The IASB therefore decided that, for the purpose of applying paragraph 6.5.12 of IFRS 9, an entity deems the amount accumulated in the cash flow hedge reserve for a discontinued hedging relationship to be based on the alternative benchmark rate on which the contractual cash flows will be based, which is similar to the amendment in paragraph 6.9.7 of IFRS 9. That amount is reclassified to profit or loss in the same period(s) in which the hedged future cash flows based on the alternative benchmark rate affect profit or loss.
